item.title: Marines Control Center Of Tikrit
item.description: Apr. 14 - US forces moved into President Saddam Hussein's hometown of Tikrit on Monday, battling hard-core Iraqi fighters.

item.title: Gunfight Outside Palestine Hotel
item.description: Apr. 13 - US Marines outside Baghdad's Palestine Hotel - where many journalists are staying - engaged in a battle with gunmen who fired on them on Sunday.

item.title: Seven U.S. POWs Found in Iraq
item.description: Apr. 13 - Iraqi troops released seven U.S. POWs -- some wounded but in good condition -- to Marines on Sunday

item.title: Multi-Million Dollar Cars Found
item.description: Apr. 14 - The Third Battalion of 4th Marines Division in Iraq have discovered a cache of multi-million dollar luxury automobiles.

item.title: Restoring Order in Baghdad
item.description: Apr. 13 - As lawlessness and looting continues in parts of Iraq's capital city, some Baghdad residents began burying the dead Sunday.

item.title: Mosul in U.S. and Kurdish Hands
item.description: Apr. 13 - The northern city of Mosul fell into U.S. and Kurdish hands Friday after an entire corps of the Iraqi army surrendered.

item.title: Aldouri Leaves U.S.
item.description: Apr. 12 - Iraq's U.N. Ambassador Mohammed Al-Douri has left the U.S. and is heading to Syria in an attempt to reconnect with his family.

item.title: Road To Tikrit Quiet
item.description: Apr. 13 - The Northern Iraqi road to Tikrit, was quiet on Sunday despite reports that fighters loyal to Saddam's regime were still holding out.

item.title: Vigilantes On Patrol
item.description: Apr. 12 - There were angry scenes on Friday as armed vigilantes confronted looters on the streets of Baghdad.

item.title: Bush Says War Not Over
item.description: Apr. 11 - President Bush said Friday he doesn't know whether Saddam Hussein is dead or alive but "I know he's no longer in power.
